author: @rajenpatel3038
text: Just started following this so kind of latecomer to the party and this is GREAT tutorial. On line# 51, isn't current_position > 0 and s in context.shorts, kind of mutually inclusive? You wouldn't have entered a short position if sentiment was -3 or lower and hence an entry exists in "shorts" list but also that would mean, current_position > 0. Since you are executing context.shorts.remove, i am thinking those two conditions at line#51 are mutually inclusive. Thoughts?

author: @ricardocortez9894
text: Sentdex., how long would you consider paper trading your algorithm before going live? I initially thought that a couple of days would be enough, but I'm getting the feeling that maybe a month or so would provide more insights.

author: @benilev6511
text: Pretty old one, but anyway :)  Seems to me like your shorts should be "sold" the next day right after you "bought" them. This is because you dont check in line 37, where you close your longs, that the specific stock is NOT in the shorted stocks list. So basically, you sell the stock if it's sentiment is below 0, which should be the case for the shorted stocks. But somehow, this algo does better than the one that doesn't short, and it doesn't make to much sense that these are 1-day earnings...  Anyway - as always, thanks for those excellent tutorials!
